text: Matt Smith has broken his silence on the pay disparity between himself and co - star Claire Foy on The Crown, claiming that ` ` amends'' have been made. Foy was paid a lower wage than Smith, who played Prince Phillip, despite having the leading role as Queen Elizabeth II in the hit Netflix drama. Smith has now spoken out, saying he supports “ best friend ” Foy and suggesting that producers have since rectified the pay gap. Speaking at the premiere of his latest film Mapplethorpe he told Hollywood Reporter : “ Claire is one of my best friends, and I believe that we should be paid equally and fairly and there should be equality for all. “ I support her completely, and I'm pleased that it was resolved and they made amends for it because that what's needed to
